mark
Thursday, August 24th, 2017, 10:54:46 PM

The dead space is ugly, but it seems to hit a sweet spot for minimal eye movement for me (on my leftmost 32" monitor, feels weird focusing on the extreme edge of the screen.) Tweaked Solarized Dark a bit for the color scheme (mostly just darkened the background color. I use bog-standard Solarized Dark for all my console and text editor/IDE windows, but for some reason I want GS to be a bit darker).

Alastir
Thursday, August 24th, 2017, 11:07:06 PM

This is my Duskruin Layout. It's normally arranged a little differently. Thoughts window to ignore when lnet gets out of hand. Speech window so I don't miss anything that's said in scrollback. Familiar window for scriptcheck so I don't miss anything. Centers my eyes in the middle of the page. (I too don't like staring at the edge.)

Alastir
Friday, August 25th, 2017, 2:30:48 PM

@viekn said in What does your FE look like?:

@alastir What are you sending to the familiar window?

There used to be a script called ;scriptcheck that would send any line not seen at least 5 times to the familiar window. It's a script to catch scriptchecks basically so they're not missed in scroll.
